title: BCB president opts out of attending India-Pakistan World Cup clash
byline: Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) president Aminul Islam has changed his mind at the last minute and decided not to travel to Colombo to watch the India-Pakistan match at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup.

title: Markram powers Proteas to World Cup win over Black Caps
byline: South Africa stormed to a commanding seven-wicket win over New Zealand national cricket team in Group D of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, powered by a breathtaking captain’s knock from Aiden

title: India vs Pakistan: A Timeline of Tensions and Turning Points
byline: The India vs Pakistan cricket rivalry is one of the most intense and closely watched contests in world sport, captivating millions with every encounter. From historic clashes across Tests and ODIs to high-voltage T20 World Cup battles, the rivalry has consistently delivered drama on and off the field. In 2025, tensions escalated beyond the boundary rope, making headlines worldwide.

title: e-BMD system issues over 8,000 certified documents for Sri Lankans overseas
byline: Sri Lanka’s Electronic Birth, Marriage and Death (e-BMD) system has issued over 8,000 certified civil documents to Sri Lankans residing overseas, marking a significant milestone in the country’s digital public service transformation programme.

title: Car suspected in Akuregoda shooting found burning in Galle
byline: The Nugegoda Divisional Criminal Investigation Bureau has located the car believed to have been used by gunmen in the fatal shooting of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda, Thalangama.

title: Obama addresses racist video shared by Trump depicting him as an ape
byline: Former US President Barack Obama has indirectly addressed a racist video posted on President Donald Trump’s social media, telling a podcast host that the ’’shame’’ and ’’decorum’’ that once guided public officials is now lost.

title: Verité Research poll shows Sri Lanka turns more optimistic amidst strong government approval
byline: Colombo– Sri Lankans are expressing growing optimism about the country’s direction, with strong approval ratings for the government and a significant rise in economic confidence, according to the latest “Mood of the Nation” poll conducted by Verité Research. The polling partner for the survey was Vanguard Survey (Pvt) Ltd.

title: NPP lawyers condemn brutal killing of attorney and wife; demand swift justice
byline: While condemning the assassination of Attorney-at-Law Buddhika Mallawaarachchi and his wife, lawyers of the National People’s Power (NPP) urged the government to accelerate its efforts to restore public safety and the rule of law.

title: Locals go crazy over non-availability of tickets
byline: With the much-anticipated India–Pakistan clash at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 taking place today, many Sri Lankan cricket fans say they have struggled to secure tickets, as availability remained extremely limited and prices soared in the secondary market.

title: Probe and reveal truth behind killing of lawyer, wife: Sajith
byline: The government should disclose the truth behind the killing of a lawyer and his wife within the high security zone, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said in a statement today.

title: Namal calls for probe into foreign funding linked to Aragalaya
byline: Sri Lanka Podu Jana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser MP Namal Rajapaksa called for an investigation into alleged foreign funding linked to the Aragalaya  protest movement.

title: Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using dart frog toxin, UK says
byline: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was killed using a poison developed from a dart frog toxin, the UK and European allies have said.

title: Government committed to strengthening national health sector
byline: The Government has reaffirmed its strong commitment to strengthening the national health sector, with a focus on systemic reforms, increased state investment, and enhanced efficiency. Addressing the 9th Annual Academic Sessions of the Sri Lanka College of Military Medicine (SLCOMM) held at the Waters Edge Hotel in Battaramulla,

title: CM Stalin urges Jaishankar to expedite return of fishermen from Sri Lanka
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Saturday penned a letter to Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar, urging for immediate action to facilitate the return of Tamil Nadu fishermen released by the Sri Lankan court to their homeland,

title: President Anura Kumara, Jay Shah and Naqvi attend India-Pakistan T20 clash in Colombo
byline: The R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium hosted a star-studded crowd tonight as Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake attended the India–Pakistan match in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026.

title: BASL to boycott courts on Monday over Akuregoda lawyer killing
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka has decided to abstain from court proceedings across the country tomorrow (16) following the recent shooting to death of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda.

title: Hanumankind to Perform in Colombo Before India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup 2026 Clash
byline: Colombo is ready for a blockbuster night as Hanumankind performs ahead of the India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup 2026 clash. With the match just an hour away, anticipation inside and outside the R Premadasa Stadium has reached fever pitch. Music, rivalry and high stakes are set to collide in what promises to be one of the most watched games of the tournament.

title: T20 World Cup 2026: Kishan’s blitz fires India to 175
byline: In a high-stakes encounter at the R. Premadasa Stadium, India set a challenging target of 176 for arch-rivals Pakistan, largely propelled by a breathtaking 77-run knock from opener Ishan Kishan. Despite an early setback and a middle-order squeeze by Pakistan’s spinners, India finished their 20 overs at 175/7 on a tacky Colombo surface that offered significant turn.

title: Hundreds of thousands join Iran protests around the world
byline: Hundreds of thousands of people took part in demonstrations around the world against the Iranian government on Saturday, following calls from the exiled son of the late shah for a ’’global day of action’’.

title: Obama addresses racist video shared by Trump depicting him as an ape
byline: Former US President Barack Obama has indirectly addressed a racist video posted on President Donald Trump’s social media, telling a podcast host that the ’’shame’’ and ’’decorum’’ that once guided public officials is now lost.
